ab.title: Genesis 47
ab.l: And Joseph came and told Pharaoh, and said,‘My father and my brothers, and their flocks, and their cattle,and all that they have, came out of the land of Canaan. And,lo, they are in the land of Goshen.’
And he took someof his brothers, five men, and presented thembefore Pharaoh.
And Pharaoh saidto Jacob’s brothers, ‘What is your work?’ And they said to Pharaoh,‘Your servants are shepherds, and our fathers, too.’

And they said to Pharaoh, ‘We came to live in the landbecause your servants have no pasture for their flocks becausethe famine became stronger in the land of Canaan. And now may your servants dwellin the land of Goshen.’
And Pharaoh saidto Joseph, ‘Your father and your brothers have come to you.

The land of Egypt is before you.Settle your father and your brothers in the better place of the land.They shall dwell in the land of Goshen. And if you know,or if there is any able men among them, then you shall make themlivestock superiors over those that are mine.’
And Joseph brought in Jacob his father, andstood him before Pharaoh. And Jacob blessedPharaoh.
And Pharaoh said to Jacob, ‘How manyare the days of the years of your life?’

And Jacob saidto Pharaoh, ‘The days of the years of my life are a hundred and thirty years.The days of the years of my life have been few and bad, and have not attainedto the days of the years of the life of my fathers, in the days of their life.’
And Jacob offered peace to Pharaoh, andwent out from before Pharaoh.
And Joseph settledhis father and his brothers, and gave them a possessionin the land of Egypt, in the better place of the land, in the landof Rameses, as Pharaoh had commanded.
And Joseph nourished his father, and his brothers, andall the people of his father’s house, with bread,according to the food of the little ones.
And there was no bread in allthe land, for the famine became very much stronger, so that the all the people ofthe land of Egypt and of the land of Canaan went insane by reason of the famine.
And Joseph gathered up all the silverthat was found in the land of Egypt and in the land of Canaanfor the grain which they bought. And Joseph broughtthe money to Pharaoh’s house.

And when the silver came to an end from the land of Egypt and from the landof Canaan, all the Egyptians came to Joseph, saying,‘Give us bread! And why should we die before you? Becausethe silver came to an end.’
And Joseph said, ‘Give your livestock,and I will give you bread for your livestock if the silver is gone.’

And they brought their livestock to Joseph,and Joseph gave them bread for the horses, and for the multitude ofsheep, and for the multitude of cattle, and for the donkeys.And he led them out with bread for all their livestockin that year.

And that year was ended, andthey came to him the second year, and said to him, ‘We will not hide itfrom my lord that in truth the silver has come to an end, andmy lord has the multitude of |our| livestock as well. There is nothing left before my lord,but our bodies, and our lands.

Why shall we diebefore your eyes, both we and our land? Buy us andour land for bread, and we and our land will be servants to Pharaoh.And give us seed, that we may live and not die, that the landmay not be ruined.
And Joseph bought all the landof Egypt for Pharaoh, because the Egyptians sold every man his field,because the famine prevailed over them. So the land becamePharaoh’s.
And the people: he ordered them to goto cities, from one edge of Egypt’s borders even to its |other| edge.

Only the land of the priests he did not buy,because the priests had a portion assigned them of Pharaoh, and did eattheir portion which Pharaoh gave them. On account of thisthey did not sell their land.
AndJoseph said to the people, ‘Lo, I have bought youand your land for Pharaoh today. Lo, here is seed for you, andyou shall sow the land.

And it shall be, in the harvest,that you shall give the fifth part to Pharaoh, and fourparts shall be your own, for field seed, and for your food,and for them in your houses, and for food for your little ones.’
And they said, ‘You have revived us. Let us find favourin the eyes of my lord, and we will be Pharaoh’s servants.’
And Joseph made it a statute to this day over the landof Egypt, that Pharaoh should have up to the fifth part. Only the landof the priests did not become Pharaoh’s.
And Israel dwelt in the land of Egypt, in the landof Goshen. And they had possessions in it. And they spread,and multiplied very much.Parashat Vayechi
And Jacob livedin the land of Egypt seventeen years. So the daysof Jacob, the days of his life, were a hundred and forty-seven years.

And Israel’s days to die drew close. And he calledhis son Joseph, and said to him, ‘If, now, I have foundfavour in your eyes, I pray you, put now your hand under my thigh, and do kindness and truth with me, I pray you, do not bury me in Egypt.
But let me lie by my fathers. And carryme out of Egypt, and bury me in their cemetery.’ Andhe said, ‘I will do according to your words.’
Andhe said, ‘Swear to me.’ And he swore to him. And Israel bowed himselfat the head of the bed.
